content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my preference for security and avoiding risks, I would choose the option that guarantees a consistent payout, even if it's slightly lower. In this case, choosing 'B' ensures me an average of 40$ per round (ignoring the one-time 35$ payout when the opponent chooses R).

However, if I pick 'R', there is a risk that my opponent might pick 'B', resulting in a loss for both rounds. Although the occasional 35$ payout might seem appealing, the potential for frequent losses could lead to a lower overall average payout.

In a game with 75 rounds, even though I cannot predict what my opponent will choose, it seems rational to stick with the safer option 'B' that provides more consistent earnings over time.

So, my choice would be {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

In this case, since both of us have chosen 'B', we will each earn 40$ again for this round.

As I mentioned earlier, even though I cannot predict what my opponent will choose in future rounds, choosing 'B' consistently provides a more reliable income over time compared to the riskier option 'R'. Therefore, I will continue to choose 'B' in subsequent rounds as well.
